topic.title: cf-mgmt Tool Example: Create a Starter Cluster

body.p: The following is an example on how to create a small starter cluster with a core node and one DEA.

You can create any number of identical clusters using the same bootstrap file. However, each configuration requires its own file. For example, if you need five medium and five small clusters, you would need two boostrap files; one to create five identical medium clusters, and one to create five small.

ol.li: Download the latest bootstrap.yml and save it in the same folder where the cf-mgmt tool is installed.

Open and configure the bootstrap.yml file to match your environment. Here is an example:constructor-image-name: HPE Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HPE Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My Cluster Prefix> dea-count: 1 dea-flavor: standard.large az: <My Availability Zones>Please ensure the values for image names, image sizes and availability zones ("az") are valid for your current configuration.

Run the following set of commands. cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url <OpenStack authentication URL> ^ --os-username <username> ^ --os-password <password> ^ --os-tenant-id <id> ^ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" ^ --os-region-name "<region-name>" ^ create-cluster ^ --keypair-name <keypair name> ^ --admin-email <admin email> ^ --admin-password <admin password> ^ --max-cluster-wait-duration -1 ^ --max-corenode-wait-duration -1 ^ --load bootstrap.ymlA value of -1 indicates an infinite duration.
